lead_paragraph: The new alignment and the absence of any Western powers at the table all but guarantee that President Bashar al-Assad will continue to rule Syria under any resulting agreement.

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Beirut, and David E. Sanger from Washington.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and DAVID E. SANGER

headline.print_headline: 3 Nations Meet for Syria Talks, Excluding U.S.
headline.main: Russia, Iran and Turkey Meet for Syria Talks, Excluding U.S.

snippet: The new alignment and the absence of any Western powers at the table all but guarantee that President Bashar al-Assad will continue to rule Syria under any resulting agreement....
abstract: Representatives from Russia, Iran and Turkey meet in Moscow to work on policy for ending Syria's nearly six-year war, excluding United States from talks; United Nations is also not consulted; gains by pro-Syrian forces in Aleppo and elsewhere and absence of Western representatives at talks ensure likelihood that Pres Bashar al-Assad will remain in power.
